headline: Criminal Justice Judge Denies Trump Dojs Request Unseal Ghislaine Maxwell Grand Jury Documents
summary: A US district judge denied the Trump administration's request to unseal grand jury testimony from the criminal case againstGhislaine Maxwell, an associate of the late financier and convicted sex offenderJeffrey Epstein.The Details:The Trump administration's Justice Department (DOJ) was seeking to release materials related to the Epstein investigation, followingcriticismfrom supporters for announcing that no additional files would be released. However, Judge Paul Engelmayer of the Southern District of New York rejected the request, stating that the transcripts did not meet the "special circumstances" threshold and would not reveal new or consequential information about Epstein and Maxwell's crimes. He suggested that the push to release documents might be an intentional diversion.For Context:Ghislaine Maxwell is currently serving a 20-year prison sentence for sex trafficking and other offenses in connection with Epstein.How The Media Covered It:The Independent (Lean Left bias)said, "Trump asked Attorney General Pam Bondi to produce 'any and all pertinent' grand jury transcripts in the criminal cases of Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein in a bid to tamp down further conspiracies over the government's botched handling of the so-called 'Epstein Files.'"CNN (Lean Left)saidthe judge issued a "scathing opinion," in which he noted, "It was clear the government was not familiar with the Maxwell trial record, 'because a number of details that it identified as non-public in fact had been testified to during the trial.'"ABC News (Lean Left)pointed out, "The Justice Department and FBI announced last month that they had found no evidence that Epstein kept such a list, after several top officials, before joining the administration, had themselves accused the government of shielding information regarding the Epstein case."The Daily Mail (Right)similarly highlightedthe administration's past comments: "In July, the Justice Department said the Jeffrey Epstein list does not exist. The president promised he would release the Epstein files as part of his re-election campaign, saying Democrats are hiding the truth about the case."The New York Post (Lean Right)did notinclude those details.Revised by the AllSides staff (of humans) after a first draft from our custom AI.Learn more.Support our mission.
